071cf540-ad28-4fa5-950f-ab9bed8b0639.description: Earners of this designation have demonstrated the ability to apply the Cognitive Disabilities Model with clients who have Alzheimer's Disease or Related Dementias. Earners can differentiate between Allen Cognitive Levels and performance modes, select tools to assess functional cognition and provide caregiver education about remaining abilities. Earners can identify methods for writing goals, treatment plans, and notes to establish that services are skilled, reasonable, and medically necessary.
071cf540-ad28-4fa5-950f-ab9bed8b0639.name: Level I Understanding Cognition Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Instruct or complete Legacy’s proprietary three part Understanding Cognition Series including Part 1: A Foundation, Part 2: Tools and Techniques, and Part 3: Treatment Approaches
Learners receive a passing score on each of the three corresponding exams

aa0d99bb-a9a2-4935-9403-cc4270a43778.description: Earners of this badge were contributors towards a deficiency-free survey. The badge earner contributed towards the demonstration of how Legacy Healthcare Services meets local, state, and federal regulations. The badge earner engaged in survey readiness efforts, was an Agency Administrator, Alternate Agency Administrator, communicated directly with the surveyor during the survey process, or functioned as an off-site contributor by providing additional requested information in a timely fashion.
aa0d99bb-a9a2-4935-9403-cc4270a43778.name: Deficiency-Free Survey Award

badge_template_activities.title: The employee participated in survey readiness efforts and/or the survey process.
The outcome was a deficiency-free survey.
The survey occurred in the past year from issuance.

4785d983-e0c5-4046-b333-1af342335f02.description: Earners of this designation can identify underlying impairments and functional deficits associated with geriatric deconditioning. Earners can select standardized tests, develop and progress skilled interventions related to strengthening, balance, activity tolerance, urinary incontinence, and functional safety. Earners can establish or contribute to a plan of care for rehabilitation of the frail, elderly client and document treatments that are skilled, reasonable, and medically necessary.
4785d983-e0c5-4046-b333-1af342335f02.name: Level I Frail Elder Rehabilitation Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Instruct or complete Legacy’s proprietary three part Understanding Cognition Series including Part 1: A Foundation, Part 2: Tools and Techniques, and Part 3: Treatment Approaches
Instruct or complete Legacy’s proprietary course titled "Progressive Exercise Prescription Program", including previous course versions of this topic offered by Legacy Healthcare Services.
Instruct or complete Legacy’s proprietary course titled "Safety in Motion-A Focus on Balance", including previous course versions of this topic offered by Legacy Healthcare Services.
Instruct or complete the course titled "One-Rep Max: Strength Training for the Geriatric Client", including previous course versions of this topic offered by Legacy Healthcare Services.
Instruct or complete Legacy’s proprietary course titled "Continence Management", including previous course versions of this topic offered by Legacy Healthcare Services.
Instruct or complete Legacy's proprietary course titled "Assessment and Treatment of Low Vision", including previous course versions of this topic offered by Legacy Healthcare Services.
Learner receives a passing score on the corresponding exams.

1dc1cb54-2596-47a3-97ed-d72f1464e8fd.description: Earners of this designation have demonstrated the ability to recognize the clinical relevance of clients suffering from urinary incontinence. Earners can differentiate between the types of urinary incontinence, select tools to assess severity, and identify a variety of intervention approaches for treating urinary incontinence. Earners can identify methods for writing goals, treatment plans, and notes to establish that services were skilled, reasonable, and medically necessary.
1dc1cb54-2596-47a3-97ed-d72f1464e8fd.name: Level I Continence Management Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Instruct or complete Legacy’s proprietary course titled "Continence Management", including previous course versions of this topic offered by Legacy Healthcare Services
Instruct or complete Legacy’s proprietary three part Understanding Cognition Series including Part 1: A Foundation, Part 2: Tools and Techniques, and Part 3: Treatment Approaches
Instruct or complete Legacy’s proprietary Continence Management Using Yoga-style Pelvic Floor Muscle Exercises course
Complete CEU360’s course titled Take Control: Continence Care Is Every Healthcare Provider’s Business course
Learners receive a passing score on each courses' corresponding exams

44b84060-e5e1-43d0-b219-b9e4de66f9a2.description: Earners of this designation are able to recognize the clinical symptoms (motor and non-motor) of idiopathic and atypical Parkinson’s Disease. Earners can identify assessments, as well as intervention approaches that utilize the concepts of neuroplasticity and high-intensity exercise. Earners can identify or contribute towards methods for writing goals and developing treatment plans to establish that services are skilled, reasonable, and medically necessary.
44b84060-e5e1-43d0-b219-b9e4de66f9a2.name: Level I Parkinson's Disease Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Instruct or complete Legacy’s proprietary course titled Assessing and Treating Parkinson’s Disease: An Introduction
Instruct or complete Legacy’s proprietary three part Understanding Cognition Series including Part 1: A Foundation, Part 2: Tools and Techniques, and Part 3: Treatment Approaches
Complete CEU360’s course titled A Practical Evidence Based Approach to Evaluating and Treating Individuals with Parkinson’s Disease
Learner must receive a scored a passing score on the corresponding exams

210da2bc-bab4-499e-8117-4685bdb403e3.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated the ability to identify the entities and guidance that oversee conduct associated with Rehabilitation Agencies (RAs). The badge earner can relate Legacy Healthcare Services’ Policies and Procedures to Conditions of Participation and Standards for RAs. The badge earner can defend how the clinic is meeting Conditions of Participation and Standards for RAs. The badge earner can judge the readiness of a clinic for a survey and make recommendations.
210da2bc-bab4-499e-8117-4685bdb403e3.name: Survey Readiness Specialist

badge_template_activities.title: Instruct or complete Legacy Healthcare Services’ proprietary training titled Survey Readiness Part I: Agency Administrator and Delegate Training or a previously offered version of this course

Instruct or complete Legacy Healthcare Services’ proprietary training titled Survey Readiness Part II: Conditions of Participation and Standards for Rehabilitation Agencies or a previously offered version of this course
Instruct or complete Legacy Healthcare Services’ proprietary training titled Survey Readiness Part III: Survey Binder Review or a previously offered version of this course
Instruct or complete Legacy Healthcare Services’ proprietary training titled Survey Readiness Part IV: Virtual Mock Survey or a previously offered version of this course

e6303444-1b9f-4173-bd2d-719b147e99bf.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated the ability to assist the department in meeting goals and routinely participating in program(s). Earners follow protocols, gather, document, and report outcome measures. Earners effectively use communication skills of listening, questioning, verifying, and explaining to create rapport to allow for discovery of needs. Earners distribute information using a variety of methods such as modeling, instructing, and facilitating in-services and presentations.
e6303444-1b9f-4173-bd2d-719b147e99bf.name: Clinical Program Lead

badge_template_activities.title: Completed Legacy's proprietary course titled Safety in Motion-A Focus on Balance
Completed Legacy's proprietary course titled One-Rep Max: Strength Training for the Geriatric Client
Completed Legacy's proprietary course titled Progressive Exercise Prescription Program
Completed Legacy's proprietary course titled Intro to Low Vision
Completed Legacy's proprietary course titled Continence Management
Instruct or complete Legacy’s proprietary three part Understanding Cognition Series including Part 1: A Foundation, Part 2: Tools and Techniques, and Part 3: Treatment Approaches
Earner passed the corresponding exams for the courses
Earner must have attained the level of a Clinical Program Lead and fulfill the requirements for a period of not less than 90 days.

6f4b49cd-eb29-41b9-8c67-5da169df676c.description: Earners of this designation have demonstrated the ability to accurately score the Large Allen Cognitive Level Screen-5 and the Allen Diagnostic Module Placemat with clients who have Alzheimer's Disease or Related Dementias. Earners can utilize skilled observation techniques to identify patterns of performance associated with Allen Cognitive Levels during dressing, hygiene, and transfers. Earners can develop or contribute to a plan of care, and develop client-centered treatment interventions.
6f4b49cd-eb29-41b9-8c67-5da169df676c.name: Level II Dementia Management Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Earn Level I Dementia Management Certification
Instruct or complete Legacy’s proprietary Building Assessment and Intervention Skills for Clients with Dementia: An Unorthodox Approach course
Learners must receive a passing score on the corresponding exam
Learners must complete and submit a case study and professional reflection

8dabc501-36a5-4c94-8ace-578d888520e4.description: Earners of this designation have demonstrated the ability to select and model evidence-based treatment approaches with clients who have Parkinson’s Disease. Earners can select and administer standardized assessments to identify underlying impairments and address impairments such as bradykinesia and hypokinesia. Earners have demonstrated the ability to apply the principles of neuroplasticity, high intensity exercises, and effective teaching techniques to improve functional abilities.
8dabc501-36a5-4c94-8ace-578d888520e4.name: Level II Parkinson's Disease Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Instruct or complete Legacy’s proprietary live course titled Parkinson’s Disease: Clinical  Manifestations – An Advanced Training Opportunity
Learner must receive a passing score on the corresponding exam
Learner must complete and submit a case study and professional reflection
Level I Parkinson's Disease Certification

7429d04c-a640-402c-9699-2e4c5598c48f.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated the ability to use a standardized performance review process with employees. Earners can plan for a performance review and initiate use of the Clinical Confidence Check to assess the employee’s confidence with job skills. Earners can assess the employee’s performance in documentation, clinical skills, interpersonal skills, and efficiency. Earners can complete the process using organizational software and facilitate a conversation about professional growth.
7429d04c-a640-402c-9699-2e4c5598c48f.name: Performance Review Specialist

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Legacy Healthcare Services’ proprietary training titled "Annual Performance Review Process"

Complete at least five performance reviews using Legacy Healthcare Services’ standardized approach or function as the approving manager for at least two performance reviews that used Legacy Healthcare Services' standardized approach

f1de4b39-313c-4414-a7d4-8b704e28ef9f.description: Earners of this designation have demonstrated the ability to identify how pain and low vision impact the frail, elderly client. The earner is able to develop or contribute to a plan of care, including the development of skilled interventions and goal setting. The earner has applied the knowledge within the context of a client case study and has completed a professional reflection.
f1de4b39-313c-4414-a7d4-8b704e28ef9f.name: Level II Frail Elder Rehabilitation Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Instruct or complete Legacy's proprietary course titled "Pain Management Evaluation and Treatment"
Learner must receive a passing score on the corresponding exam for each course
Level I Frail Elder Rehabilitation Certification
Learners must complete and submit a case study and professional reflection

566f955d-a8b5-405c-b5b9-ce177134bd2d.description: Earners of this designation have demonstrated the ability to identify functional impairments of the musculoskeletal system limiting client mobility, function, and quality of life. Earners are able to identify the functional anatomy of the involved joint, understand proper movement patterns and alignment, and treatment techniques to improve function. Earners are able to evaluate, create or contribute towards a treatment plan of care for clients with orthopedic conditions.
566f955d-a8b5-405c-b5b9-ce177134bd2d.name: Level I Orthopedic Rehabilitation Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Instruct or complete Legacy’s proprietary course titled Treatment of the Adult Shoulder Complex
Instruct or complete Legacy’s proprietary course titled SI Joint Dysfunction: Pelvic Innominate Assessment and Correction
Complete the CEU360 course titled Joint Replacement Rehabilitation for the Shoulder, Hip, and Knee
Learner must receive a passing score on the corresponding exams

fe82b0c6-886c-4d91-a845-fc7300d12bed.description: Earners of this designation have demonstrated the basic skills needed to identify the complexities of pain that limit client mobility, safety, and independence. Earners are able to utilize a variety of outcome measures and tools to quantify activity limitation and functional disability during daily activities. Earners can develop or contribute to a plan of care, including the selection of pain management techniques and interventions in order to improve the client’s function and independence.
fe82b0c6-886c-4d91-a845-fc7300d12bed.name: Level I Pain Management Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Instruct or complete Legacy’s proprietary Pain Management Assessment and Treatment course
Instruct or complete Legacy’s proprietary One Rep Max: Strength Training for the Geriatric Client course
Complete the CEU360 course titled Therapeutic Modalities: An Evidence-Based Approach course
Complete the CEU360 course titled Geriatric Massage: Evidence Based Approach to Improve Functional Outcomes and Quality of Life course
Learner must receive a passing grade on corresponding exams

4c79853d-efc5-4bd0-b8fb-907dc201cdce.description: Earners of this designation have demonstrated the ability to identify the functional impairments of clients experiencing low vision. Earners can list the five most common eye diseases and their symptoms, recognize the definition of low vision, and the subsequent implications on a patient's ability to perform ADLS/IADLs, mobility, and balance. Earners are able to recommend appropriate environmental modifications and able to locate resources.
4c79853d-efc5-4bd0-b8fb-907dc201cdce.name: Level 1 Low Vision Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Instruct or complete Legacy's proprietary course titled "Intro to Low Vision: A Generalist's Approach to Assessment and Treatment Strategies," including previous course versions of this topic offered by Legacy Healthcare Services.
Instruct or complete Legacy’s proprietary three part Understanding Cognition Series including Part 1: A Foundation, Part 2: Tools and Techniques, and Part 3: Treatment Approaches
Complete CEU360's course titled Introduction to Low Vision Care
Learners receive a passing score on each courses' corresponding exams

94995f23-8497-4f5b-a8c5-c9db28cba241.description: Earners of this designation have demonstrated the ability to identify the impact orthopedic conditions have on a client’s functional performance, safety, and mobility. Earners are able to incorporate strength training, manual therapy, patient education, and therapeutic modalities to treat orthopedic conditions. Earners can identify methods for writing goals, treatment plans, and notes to establish that services were skilled, reasonable, and medically necessary.
94995f23-8497-4f5b-a8c5-c9db28cba241.name: Level II Orthopedic Rehabilitation Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Instruct or complete Legacy’s proprietary course titled "One Rep Max: Strength Training for the Geriatric Client", including previous course versions of this topic offered by Legacy Healthcare Services.
Complete the CEU360 course titled Therapeutic Modalities: An Evidence-Based Approach.
Complete the CEU360 course titled Introduction to Kinesiology Taping: Orthopedic Conditions.
Learner must receive a passing score on the corresponding exams.
Learner must complete and submit a case study and professional reflection
Level I Orthopedic Rehabilitation Certification

8d5a60d7-32a3-4c48-ab49-a7d566be768d.description: Earners of this designation have demonstrated the ability to identify the emotional and physical impact of pain on functional performance. Earners can apply physical agent modalities, manual therapy techniques, kinesiology tape, and teach Tai Chi for pain reduction. Earners can develop or contribute towards a plan of care, including goals, frequency and duration, and the integration of various interventions to reduce the client’s disabilities and improve quality of life.
8d5a60d7-32a3-4c48-ab49-a7d566be768d.name: Level II Pain Management Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Earn Level I Pain Management Certification.
Instruct or complete Legacy’s proprietary Arthritis and Chronic Pain in the Older Adult: Strategies to Improve Functional Performance course.
Instruct or complete Legacy’s proprietary course titled "The Kinesio Tex® Taping Method", including previous course versions of the topic offered by Legacy Healthcare Services.
Learner must receive a passing score on each course exam.
Learner must complete and submit a case study and professional reflection.
